Despite the scenery change, which I was skeptical of (I wanted more stories form rapture), this game is amazing. The story, characters and world-building are all befitting of the Bioshock title. Is it as good as the first game? Maybe not. But it comes close, and definitely lives up to the legend. 

If you are hesitant about it coming from the first or second game, I highly recommend it. Itâ€™s the same gameplay, with better (if a little different) storytelling, and fantastic worldbuilding. Itâ€™s a wonderful twist on the theory of rapture. I wouldnâ€™t have thought it possible for a sequel, but they managed to create a plot as amazing as the first game in a brand new way without hurting the original story or trying to out-do it. 

If you have never played a Bioshock game beforeâ€¦.fear not. You need not have an understanding of the predecessors to enjoy this game. (Hopefully it leaves a good enough mark to get you to try the first game). If you like action-adventure games, in a shooter setting, if you like exploring deep meaningful worldbuilding, or if you just want a good story made for a game. Check this out.

Ho boy, I've yet to experience a game that oozes as much charisma and story-line-goodness as Bioshock Infinite. Very poignant to today, get ready to get mad and then recondition what you thought was an absolute truth. It's an incredible experience with excellent gameplay. Technically a shooter, but it does a great job at breaking the mold. It could use some work on shooting mechanics (but for a game over 10 years old, not bad at all!). All in all, this game is a good shooter and one of the best story lines I've ever played. Don't put it off any longer, especially if you're a Bioshock fan.

An awesome shooter in a great setting with a more than interesting story. Looks still good on ultra and is easy to play, maybe too easy in some parts. I played on Normal and only died two times on my first run. The whole atmosphere carries the gameplay a little bit but thats OK. The ending took me a solid minute to fully understand, but when the realisation hit I loved it. 

All in all still worth playing today.

One of the best fps ever made. The combat is very fun and the world design is gorgeous. What stands out the most, is the storyline and many different philosophical themes that the game highlights. This game definitely dives into the Schrodinger's Cat and quantum theory subtly. Alternate universes and infinite realities is something that is usually not done well in games, movies, or books, but this game gets a 10/10 for its tackle at something humans can barely comprehend while still managing to provide such a deep and profound story full of rich themes. I highly recommend, even to those who hate fps ( I'm one of them, but this one changed my view)

May refund it soon, sad actually because until now the game was great. What on earth was Irrational Games even thinking? It's an actual fucking scam.

[b][u]ADDITION AFTER ENDING THE STORY:[/u][/b] My negative opinion remains unchanged, and not only because there are no quick-saves for a 2013 release. I hate it when games
[list]
[*]have a such mysterious story that it's already painful 
[*]have a world that doesn't seem alive
[*]create more questions than they answer
[*]don't properly introduce you to all gameplay mechanics
[*]are overpriced for the playtime they offer
[*]make the protagonist the only likeable character
[*]make no attempts to introduce you to the villain properly
[*]have a dialouge of which a lot is just... dumb gibberish
[*]give you an unlikeable companion which they don't try to connect with the player's character, nor give him use in combat
[*]have gunplay that's made of literal garbage (in this case, it's made even worse with the addition of many more questionable gameplay decisions)
[/list]

I'm shocked that over 90% of the user reviews are positive.

After playing this game for 10h this does not feel like bioshock at all. It feels like a rip off game of bioshock made by the same company. The game mechanics are different, the feel of the game is different. I felt like I was watching a movie rather than playing a game. It's very hard to tell where to go as there is no map at all, and the side quests they give are also useless without a map so I stopped doing them after couple of them. If the new Biochock comes I hope they don't disappoint me like they did with this. The first 2 games were such masterpieces that I could not stop playing the game. When I dove into this one I wanted to stop after 2h of game play. There is hardly any challenge in this game, and everything is pretty much easy. You also don't need to plan anything. The concept of collecting adam is gone, no splicers.
